jobDescription: Data Scientists Location  TX - San Antonio Job Code 4555 # of openings 8Apply NowKe`aki Technologies is looking for qualified Data Scientists to support an Air Force Medical Services (AFMS) contract by providing expertise in the areas of Data Science and Decision Support Analysis. DUTIES INCLUDE:Provide analytical tools and resources to assess the health of the AF beneficiary population.Provide technical expertise in the areas of prevention, managed care, medical readiness issues, health promotion, clinical safety and quality, and other health Service-related issues in order to support the AFMS’s vision of becoming the healthiest and highest performing segment of the US by 2025.Perform clinical and business analytical studies using accepted data science techniques to provide insight into areas of trending/improvement for prevention, managed care, medical readiness issues, health promotion, clinical safety and quality, and other health Service-related issues.Aggregate and analyze population health data to respond to questions from the various Congressional inquiries, DoD senior leaders, AFMOA, AF Surgeon General, Service-specific Headquarters agencies, and the MTFs.Access, validate and analyze information about the AF population by developing, validating and linking various medical, safety, environmental, occupational and personnel databases.Identify and troubleshoot data import, analysis, and display errors from multiple data sources.Provide data analysis and decision support using research expertise as well as literature review/evidence-base to develop clinical and business measures and prototypes of health information technology (IT) tools, programs, procedures, services or databases to support AFMOA’s goal of building a managed healthcare system that considers and optimizes safety, quality, cost and access.Research, identify and apply, when available, national/standardized benchmarks and thresholds to AFMS/MHS metrics as appropriate or the contractor shall identify reasons established benchmarks/thresholds/methods are not appropriate/relevant.Provide technical knowledge to customers, internal and external to AFMS/AF, regarding study design and methodologies.Provide program management to refine the business and clinical measures and prototypes for optimal implementation by AFMS and other agencies/MHS as appropriate.Use established and updated data science and analytical/statistical techniques/methodologies, tools (e.g., software).Have the ability to understand and show sufficient proficiency to code/ recode/rewrite using Structured Query Language (SQL).Provide program data queries and analyses integrating medical knowledge and analytical software applications as available.Provide programming and coding subject matter support for refining the development of new systems and for optimal implementation by the AFMS, DoD and other agencies as needed.Provide technical consultation and customer support for implementation, troubleshooting and management for these and other public health, primary care and health promotion activities.Provide Information Management/Information Technology (IM/IT) support for the AFMS.Provide evaluation of program operations and consultation for questions/concerns across regions, from Managed Care Support Contractors (MCSC), MTFs, AFMS, and other users of the applicable program.Coordinate and arrange for program data transfer from AFMS, MCSCs, MTFs, and other users of various programs.Research and analyze program data.Provide/contribute technical expertise to other services, as requested by Government, in analyzing program data.Create and distribute reports to authorized AFMS personnel/staff.Collaborate with DHA and other applicable agencies to link program data with other health and personnel data to support a longitudinal database.Serve as the lead clinical and business information resource in the documentation, plan, design, build, implementation and maintenance of clinical and business information systems for the AFMS and its internal/external customers.Serve as specialized senior level functional and clinical/business domain experts and provide clinical and business expertise to successfully incorporate clinical systems within departmental and organizational environments.Provide exploratory and meta-data analysis and prepare reports as needed.Research, analyze and report data to support compelling, insightful and effective recommendations and presentations.Evaluate market viability (demographics, market competition, benefit penetration) for new service introduction, External Use Lease (EUL), federal sharing opportunities, Military Health System Support Initiatives (MHSSI), and Military Construction (MILCON).Develop/maintain tools for use by other team members to aid them in their ability to efficiently/effectively meet the team’s objectives.Conduct surveys to understand site workflows and to assess Clinical and Business Decision Support activities.Support the plan, development and implementation of Clinical and Business Decision Support activities.Research and select guidelines to translate into a knowledge representation format for use in Clinical and Business Decision Support services.Manage the content site for development, review, publication, cataloguing, and archiving of knowledge specification in human and machine readable forms.Develop web services from the knowledge representations for use in the information systems as needed.Coordinate and conduct research and evaluations of all Clinical and Business Decision Support activities.Assist with determining the priority of Clinical and Business Decision Support projects, content development, web service development, and use.Provide technical expertise to MTFs on the use of AFMS developed clinical metrics and MHS systems measures in efforts to improve the health of the enrolled population.Support the process of executing SQL jobs to implement the business rules as defined by HEDIS.Identify and migrate AFCHIPS tables to SQL Server, including those tables related to the monthly and quarterly datarefresh / reports, e.g., for AFMS Dashboard, Wing Commander’s Heads Up Display (HUD), Performance Plans / Action Plans.Assist in training, working groups, seminars and conferences.Provide a quality control program to ensure a high level of quality tasking results.Provide management and administrative support.Restructure data tables to improve accessibility and enhance analytical capabilities for AFMS users.Collaborate with Government Database Administrators (DBAs) and convert tables into a relational format as appropriate and needed/requested.Develop, produce and analyze clinical metrics as well as a variety of data products for internal/external customers.Document field inquires/concerns from AFMS, MHS, MCSCs, MTFs, and other program users and collaborate for resolutions with the system developer or applicable software programmer.Provide technical recommendations to improve program administration data collection, return rates, data usage, software utilization and similar tasks.Research and brief AFMS staff on advances in programs.Identify and troubleshoot data import, analysis, and display errors.Synthesize and evaluate information from a variety of sources, to prepare documents or provide insight with which officials can make timely and accurate decisions.Provide consultation to AFMS and other staff members to various projects and programs.Provide training within their areas of expertise.Support the AFMS and AF MTFs as they shift their focus from intervention services to improving the health of the entire population through population health initiatives.Develop, coordinate and monitor applicable program activities.Ensure configuration control documentation is maintained and includes all updates and changes.Accomplish and/or arrange for system upgrades as appropriate/necessary.Provide recommendations to improve applicable program administration, data collection, return rates, data usage, software utilization and similar tasks.Contribute to the development and delivery of curriculum/training related to clinical performance metrics.Advise MTFs on the use of AFMS developed clinical metrics and AFMS/MHS analytical tools to improve the health of enrolled population.Develop local processes and outcome measures with MTFs that will allow them to be responsive and accountable to their customers while measuring progress toward optimization plans and goals.Encourage MTFs to view performance measures as a continuous improvement process, subject to change as data systems and key objectives change.Assist MTFs as they periodically refine their measures to keep pace with clinical practice parameters and the influence of outside agencies, e.g., The Joint Commission, NCQA.Provide thorough knowledge of metrics development and process improvement.Provide knowledge and experience working with clinical, business, and readiness measures such as HEDIS, access/enrollment, safety measures and IMR requirements.Manpower and resource allocation research/analysis in order to develop and perform Currency Case Analysis (CCA), Readiness Case Analysis (RCA), and Business Case Analysis (BCA), Return on Investment (ROI), and other analyses in the form of technical reports/presentations to support AFMS decisionmaking.Provide technical expertise to MTFs to keep pace with clinical practice parameters, benchmarked to outside agencies, including but not limited to, The Joint Commission and NCQA.Recommend, develop and monitor clinical process improvement and outcome metrics.Provide the analytics and research expertise to develop prototypes of tools (e.g., AFMS Dashboard, driver diagrams, Performance Plans), programs, procedures, services or databases to support the AFMS’ goal of building a managed healthcare system that considers and optimizes safety, quality, access and resources/cost.Coordinate with AFMS Directorates and Senior leadership regarding metrics policy.Produce and distribute interim and summary processes and outcome measures for AFMS, MTFs, and MHS as required.Provide ad hoc data/reports or queries.Monitor and analyze trends in MTF performance measures/metrics in efforts to improve overall patient care.Participate in user studies to understand user behaviors/preferences and build interface solutions.Assess the project’s informational needs and dynamics.Provide technical expertise to end-users for the development of content to fit the target user/brand experience.Develop scope and understand technical requirements with input from client and/or third party partner(s).Collaborate with designers to develop interface functionality.Develop concepts through sketching and other prototyping methods.Define process test conditions and requirements.Perform operational testing as needed upon major system changes.Identify and document system deficiencies and recommend solutions.Adhere to project deadlines and schedules as defined by the Analytics Division.Provide input to Medical Director for internal/external meetings, working groups, seminars and conferences.Analyze problems, propose solutions, and meet programmatic goals.Provide information and answers to questions to internal/external AFMS Customers.Provide information to the Medical Director as required to justify, defend and negotiate significant or controversial issues at internal and external meetings. 2.9.1.86 Provide training to AFMS and other staff members on projects and programs as requested.Direct telephone inquiries to proper POC.Serve as POC for Analytics requests or in areas of subject matter expertise as requested such as clinical/business metrics, e.g. Provider Productivity/Efficiency, Enrollment.Ensure coordination of all products/services provided with the appropriate management levels, as required by applicable policies or procedures.Provide input, edit, review, develop and/or present a wide variety of documents, including letters, bullet background papers, staff summary sheets, presentations, spreadsheets, forms, metrics, reports, briefings, procedural manual development (regulations and operating instructions), etc.Prepare written business correspondence that is complete, coherent, grammatically accurate, effective, and professional and IAW AFMS/ DoD protocol.Research information and provide answers to questions for internal/external AFMS customers.Link applicable program data with other health and personnel data to support a longitudinal database.Provide technical expertise to customers.Assist customers in developing local processes and outcome measures by providing research, analyses and information.Create interactive products for use by AFMS, MAJCOM, Field Operating Agency (FOA), and MTF leadership that aid in decision support. Such products may be standalone or may be part of other “dashboard” systems.Provide programmatic support for all Performance Management initiatives/programs including, but not limited to: Providing daily, onsite support to the AFMS Analytics Medical Director.Providing coordination with SMEs (e.g. to attend/announce meetings, to deliver products by established deadlines, etc.Updating contact lists, preparing meeting agendas and capturing meeting minutes for review. Meeting minutes contain action items, issues, and risks.Coordinating daily, weekly and quarterly meetings including, but not limited to, AFMS Analytics meetings, AFMS Dashboard meetings, Performance Management Cell meetings, Lunch and Learn training sessions, Performance Management Group meetings.Regularly monitoring and coordinating several organization mail boxes / systems including, but not limited to, the TMT Task Management System, the AFMS Analytics org box, the Performance Management org box.Reviewing and maintaining system access and ensuring training is up to date.Ensuring proper Program Manager Review (PMR) of all CAPE-RS products before submission to the Medical Director or Deputy Director.Supporting other initiatives which may include training courses (e.g., Tier 1/Tier II Commander’s Course, Lunch and Learns, Group Practice Manager courses), Congressional requests for data, arranging travel, supporting Senior Leadership briefings (e.g., Medical Deputies Action Group (MDAG) briefings, SG briefings), communications (e.g., CC’s eBlast, attending Communications Cell meetings).Performing other duties as assigned by the Medical Director.Research, develop, analyze, monitor and report annual Performance Plans for AF MTFs and AF eMSMs IAW AFMS and MHS (eMSM) PerformancePlanning guidelines.Conduct financial, Joint Incentive Fund (JIF), Military Health System Support Initiatives (MHSSI), Business Case Analysis (BCA), and other resource allocation decision analysis.Conduct research and perform analysis (including development / use of predictive models for improving clinical operations and evaluating clinical currency, efficiency, and productivity) to support a variety of clinic practices initiatives and improve clinical operations and evaluate clinical currency, efficiency and productivity, including, but not limited to, provider profiling, provider productivity/efficiency, empanelment size designation/determination, referral pattern analysis, utilization of ancillary services and related activities.Provide analytical support regarding the integration, access and development of data to support the documentation, comparative analysis and outcomes analysis necessary to demonstrate the efficacy of clinical pathways designed and implemented in the MTFs.Attend meetings for Service and Enterprise/Tri-Services groups and record/report/communicate back to Government leadership items of discussion especially relevant to Analytics.Provide life cycle documentation support for development, sustainment, and operations activitiesPlan, design, research, write, and edit a range of documents to include user guides and manuals, technical specifications, training materials, support documentation and proposals.Collects and interprets technical data or information and coordinates layout for publication.Assist and support other areas of IT and the business with documentatioin needs.REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:Able to read, write, speak and understand English.Proven ability to synthesize disparate facts from multiple sources and coalesce into an accurate and useful analytic product, incorporating Service and MHS strategic goals for use by leadership in both tactical and strategic decision making.Demonstrated ability to provide accurate and timely analytical products containing well‐reasoned and cogent discussion points providing leadership with substantiated options or courses of action.Demonstrated ability to organize/participate/lead working groups to develop analytic products and byproducts or to develop/understand processes leading to effective optimization of analytic efforts.Demonstrated ability to effectively and clearly communicate analytical discoveries and appropriate recommendations/mitigation strategies to all levels of customers including Senior AFMS leadership.Demonstrated advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office products PLUS additional software/hardware skills and capabilities.Ability to critically examine and evaluate, problem-solve.Demonstrated ability to undertake and complete multiple tasks with multiple deadlines simultaneously.Ability to deliver products on time, on schedule, within budget.Flexibility and ability to adapt to rapidly changing and often time-constrained environment.Ability to acquire skills/capabilities necessary to meet growing needs/demands of systems/software/hardware.DEGREE/EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:Master’s degree in Public Health, Health Services Research, Epidemiology, Mathematics, Biostatistics, Statistics, Informatics or related areas, or previous participation in advanced training/program with one of those related areas, and identified as a Fellow in their area of expertise is required.Other significant related clinical/medical/health data experience such as previous participation in an analytics/quantitative field fellowship/training may be considered as an appropriate substitute for education, but minimum of Bachelor’s degree in above areas required unless otherwise specified
